intro: Gomphocarpus fruticosus subsp. rostratus, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, torch-like inflorescences that bear bright orange-red flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in coastal and rocky areas. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
